description: Mapping between clang-tidy-automotive checks and MISRA C:2025 rules

rules.misra_title: A function should not contain unused label declarations
rules.notes: Detects labels that are declared but never referenced.

rules.misra_title: A project should not contain unused macro declarations
rules.notes: Detects macros that are defined but never used.

rules.misra_title: A project should not contain unused type declarations
rules.notes: Detects type declarations that are never used.

rules.misra_title: A project should not contain unused tag declarations
rules.notes: Detects struct/union/enum tags that are never used.

rules.misra_title: A project should not contain unused object definitions
rules.notes: Detects objects that are defined but never used.

rules.misra_title: The character sequences /* and // shall not be used within a comment
Line-splicing shall not be used in // comments
rules.notes: Detects backslash-newline sequences in C++ comments.

rules.misra_title: Octal and hexadecimal escape sequences shall be terminated
rules.notes: Detects unterminated escape sequences in string literals.

rules.misra_title: Bit-fields shall only be declared with an appropriate type
Single-bit named bit fields shall not be of a signed type
Octal constants shall not be used
The lowercase character 'l' shall not be used in a literal suffix
rules.notes: Detects lowercase 'l' suffix which can be confused with digit '1'.

rules.misra_title: Types shall be explicitly stated
Function types shall be in prototype form with named parameters
All declarations of an object or function shall use the same names and type qualifiers
If a function has internal linkage then all re-declarations shall include the static storage class specifier
rules.notes: Detects internal functions without static keyword.

rules.misra_title: An inline function shall be declared with the static storage class
When an array with external linkage is declared, its size should be explicitly specified
rules.notes: Detects external arrays without explicit size.

rules.misra_title: Within an enumerator list, the value of an implicitly-specified enumeration constant shall be unique
The restrict type qualifier shall not be used
Arrays shall not be partially initialized
The comma operator should not be used
rules.notes: Detects comma operator usage in expressions.

rules.misra_title: The result of an assignment operator should not be used
A loop counter shall not have essentially floating type
rules.notes: Detects floating-point loop counters. Uses cert-flp30-c.

rules.misra_title: Controlling expressions shall not be invariant
The controlling expression of an if-statement and the controlling expression of an iteration-statement shall have essentially Boolean type
The goto statement should not be used
Any label referenced by a goto statement shall be declared in the same block, or in any block enclosing the goto statement
A function should have a single point of exit at the end
rules.notes: Detects multiple return statements in a function.

rules.misra_title: The body of an iteration-statement or a selection-statement shall be a compound-statement
All if...else if constructs shall be terminated with an else statement
rules.notes: Detects else-if chains without final else.

rules.misra_title: A switch label shall only be used when the most closely-enclosing compound statement is the body of a switch statement
An unconditional break statement shall terminate every switch-clause
Every switch statement shall have a default label
A default label shall appear as either the first or the last switch label of a switch statement
rules.notes: Detects default label in wrong position.

rules.misra_title: A switch-expression shall not have essentially Boolean type
The features of <stdarg.h> shall not be used
Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly
A function shall not be declared implicitly
All exit paths from a function with non-void return type shall have an explicit return statement with an expression
The value returned by a function having non-void return type shall be used
A function parameter should not be modified
Flexible array members shall not be declared
Variable-length array types shall not be used
The union keyword should not be used
The union keyword should not be used
A macro shall not be defined with the same name as a keyword
rules.notes: Detects macros named as C keywords.

rules.misra_title: #undef should not be used
The # and ## preprocessor operators should not be used
A macro parameter immediately following a # operator shall not immediately be followed by a ## operator
rules.notes: Detects # followed by ## on same parameter.

rules.misra_title: The standard header file <setjmp.h> shall not be used
The standard header file <signal.h> shall not be used
The atof, atoi, atol and atoll functions of <stdlib.h> shall not be used
The library functions abort, exit and system of <stdlib.h> shall not be used
The library functions abort, exit and system of <stdlib.h> shall not be used
The exception handling functions of <fenv.h> should not be used
The macro NULL shall be the only permitted form of integer null pointer constant

unimplemented_rules.misra_title: The program shall contain no violations of the standard C syntax and constraints
Language extensions should not be used
There shall be no occurrence of undefined or critical unspecified behaviour
unimplemented_rules.reason: Covered by UBSan and other sanitizers

unimplemented_rules.misra_title: A project shall not contain unreachable code
There shall be no dead code

manual_review_rules.misra_title: Any implementation-defined behaviour on which the output of the program depends shall be documented and understood
All source files shall compile without any compilation errors
Assembly language shall be encapsulated and isolated
If a function returns error information, then that error information shall be tested
manual_review_rules.reason: Requires semantic analysis of error handling patterns
